docs.title: Google Docs
docs.text:
• Create, edit, share, and print documents with Google Docs.
  • Use templates for work, school, or personal documents.
  • Collaborate in real time on your computer, phone, or tablet with anyone with a Google Account.

Start learning

docs.title: Learn how to add content to a document
docs.text:
•    Add an image

    Add images from various sources to your document.

    Learn more

  •    Add a chart

    Use different types of charts in your document.

    Learn more

  •    Add a table

    Organize information in a document with a table.

    Learn more

docs.title: Add a chart
docs.text:
To add a chart to the document, do the following:

  1. Open the document in Google Docs.

  2. Click Insert > Chart:

    • To add a bar chart, click Bar.
    • To add a column chart, click Column.
    • To add a line chart, click Line.
    • To import a chart from Sheets, click From Sheets:
      1. In the Insert chart dialog, select the file with the chart and click Insert.
      2. In the Import chart dialog, select the chart and click Import.

Chart is now added to the document.

docs.title: Add an image
docs.text:
To add an image to the document, do the following.

UploadWebGoogle DriveGoogle PhotosTake a photoBy URL

To upload the image from computer:

  1. Open the document in Google Docs.
  2. Click Insert > Image:
  3. Click Upload from computer.
  4. Select an image on your drive.
  5. Click Open.

To upload image from web:

  1. Open the document in Google Docs.
  2. Click Insert > Image:
  3. Click Search the web.
  4. Type the image description in the search field and press Enter.
  5. Select an image and click Insert.

To insert image from Google Drive:

  1. Open the document in Google Docs.
  2. Click Insert > Image:
  3. Click Drive.
  4. Select an image and click Insert.

To add image from Photos:

  1. Open the document in Google Docs.
  2. Click Insert > Image:
  3. Click Photos.
  4. Select an image and click Insert.

To take a photo and add it to the document:

  1. Open the document in Google Docs.
  2. Click Insert > Image:
  3. Click Camera.
  4. Click the Camera icon to take a photo.
  5. Select a photo and click Insert.

To add image by URL:

  1. Open the document in Google Docs.
  2. Click Insert > Image:
  3. Click By URL.
  4. Enter the image URL in the field and click Insert image.

Image is now added to the document.

docs.title: Add a table
docs.text:
To add a table to the document, do the following:

  1. Open the document in Google Docs.
  2. Click Insert > Table.
  3. Choose the size of the table by hovering over the table size area.

Table is now added to the document.

docs.title: Learn document basics
docs.text:
•    Create a document

    Create new documents with Docs, Drive, or existing documents.

    Learn more

  •    Download a document

    Download a document in a range of supported formats.

    Learn more

  •    Print a document

    Print a document or create a PDF using a browser.

    Learn more

docs.title: Create a document
docs.text:
To create new Google Docs document, do the following:

Google DocsGoogle DriveDocument
  1. Open Google Docs.
  2. To create blank document, click Blank document.
  3. Optional: To create new document from template, select a template from Template gallery.
  1. Open Drive.
  2. To create blank document, click New > Google Docs.
  3. Optional: To create new document from template, click New > Google Docs > From a template.
  1. Open a document.
  2. Click File > New > Document.

The document is created.

docs.title: Download a file
docs.text:
Info

Supported formats:

  • Microsoft Word (.docx)
  • OpenDocument (.odt)
  • Rich text format (.rtf)
  • PDF (.pdf)
  • Plain text (.txt)
  • HTML (.html, zipped)
  • EPUB (.epub)
  • Markdown (.md)

To download a file, do the following:

  1. Open a document in Google Docs.
  2. Click File > Download.
  3. Select the required file format.

The file will download to your computer.

docs.title: Print a document
docs.text:
To print a document, do the following:

  1. Open the document in Google Docs.
  2. Click File > Print.
  3. In the Print dialog, select required print settings:
    • From Destination list, select a printer.
    • From Pages list, select required pages.
    • From Color list, select print color.
  4. Optional: For advanced print settings, click More settings .
  5. Click Print.

Document is printed.

Info

Use Microsoft print to PDF to create a PDF file from your document.

docs.title: Format a text
docs.text:
In Google Docs, text can be formatted using menu icons or Format tab.

Prerequisites:

  • Open a document in Google Docs and select the text.

docs.title: Format with icons
docs.text:
To format a text, do the following:

  1. To change a font, select the font from the Font list.

  2. To change font size, select font size from the Font size list or enter required font size manually.

    • Optional: Click Decrease font size or Increase font size to gradually change font size.

  3. To change font style, click Bold, Italic, or Underline.

  4. To change text color, click Text color and select a color from a color picker.

  5. To highlight a text, click Highlight color and select a color from a color picker.

docs.title: Use format tab
docs.text:
To format a text, do the following:

  1. To change font style, click Format > Text:
    • To make text bold, click Bold
    • To make text italic, click Italic
    • To make text underline, click Underline.
  2. To change font size, click Format > Text > Size:
    • To increase font size, click Increase font size.
    • To decrease font size click Decrease font size.

docs.title: Learn how to manage document settings
docs.text:
•    Manage document access

    Share the files that you store in Google Drive with anyone.

    Learn more

  •    Manage the page settings

    Change page size, margins, or orientation.

    Learn more

  •    Manage add-ons

    Improve Google Docs workflow with add-ons.

    Learn more

docs.title: Install an add-on
docs.text:
To install an add-on, do the following:

  1. Open a document in Google Docs.
  2. Click Extensions > Add-ons > Get add-ons.
  3. In the Google Workspace Marketplace dialog, select the add-on.

  4. To install the add-on, click Install > Continue.

    Info

    For most add-ons, a dialog will appear requesting access. Read the message and click Allow.

  5. After the add-on installs, click Done.

Add-on is now installed.

docs.title: Turn on an add-on
docs.text:
To turn on an add-on, do the following:

  1. Open a document in Google Docs.
  2. Click Extensions > Add-ons > Manage add-ons.
  3. To turn the add-on on, click Options > Use in this document.

Add-on is now turned on for the document.

Info

To turn off an add-on, do the same steps.

docs.title: Uninstall an add-on
docs.text:
To uninstall an add-on, do the following:

  1. Open a document in Google Docs.
  2. Click Extensions > Add-ons > Manage add-ons.
  3. In the top right of the add-on card, click Options > Uninstall.
  4. In the Confirm uninstallation dialog, click Uninstall app.

Add-on is now uninstalled.

docs.title: Manage document access
docs.text:
Prerequisites:

  • Give an untitled document a name before it can be shared.

To manage document access, do the following:

  1. Open the document in Google Docs.
  2. Click Share.
  3. In the Share dialog, enter the email address you want to share with.
  4. From the list, select role:
    • Viewer
    • Commenter
    • Editor
  5. Enter notification message.
  6. Optional: To skip notifying people, clear Notify people box.
  7. Optional: Click Copy link to copy the document link.
  8. Click Send.

The document will be shared to the entered emails.

docs.title: Manage the page settings
docs.text:
Google Docs supports pages and pageless modes. To change the page settings, do the following: :

PagesPageless

  1. Open a document in Google Docs.
  2. Click File > Page setup.
  3. In the Page setup dialog, click Pages.
    • From the Apply to list, select where to apply the changes.
    • In Orientation, select Portrait or Landscape.
    • From the Paper size list, select required paper size.
    • From the Page color color picker, select the required page color.
    • In the Margins (inches) fields, enter required values for top, bottom, left, and right margin.
  4. Click OK.

  1. Open a document in Google Docs.
  2. Click File > Page setup.
  3. In the Page setup dialog, click Pageless.
  4. Optional: From the Background color color picker, select the required color.
  5. Click OK.

New settings will be applied to the document.

Info

If required, click Set as default to apply these settings to any new created document.
